To determine which team had the best game performance of the week based on Run Percentage (RPS), we need to calculate each team's RPS for their games played during that week. The RPS is calculated as:

\[ \text{RPS} = \left( \frac{\text{Successful Completions}}{\text{Total Completions}} \right) \times 100 \]

However, with the provided data only including Team B's attendance on May 29 (22,738), we lack sufficient information to compare performances across teams. Additional data on other teams' successful completions and total completions for their respective games during the week would be necessary to accurately determine which team had the highest RPS.

In conclusion, without complete weekly performance data for all relevant teams, it is not possible to definitively identify which team achieved the best game performance for that week. Further information on each team's games and completions is required for an accurate comparison using RPS.
